lol. funny.

Maybe they are launching suborbital tourists from LC-36 A+B in the future. If they are going to do SpaceX-style 1st stage recovery (likely), I propose Blue Origin to land them at LC-11 or 12. I think it's a good location, being very close to launch site (advantageous b/c rocket most likely will only go straight up into space, as it does not have to go into orbit), having plenty of space for landing, and being empty since the 60's.

EDIT: Apparently they are now making orbital launch systems, reusing first stages SpaceX style. I guess the West Texas launch site they have is too small for this stuff.

Suborbital would still work from LC-36, though that's probably not planned from there. Time will tell.
